title: Henrikh Mkhitaryan needed protecting at Manchester United, says Jose Mourinho
text:
Henrikh Mkhitaryan has found his best form after a slow start (Picture: Getty) Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho claims that Henrikh Mkhitaryan needed protecting at the start of his career in the Premier League and that his being eased into the team has helped him flourish at this stage in the season.
Arsenal star criticises Arsene Wenger's team selection vs Chelsea The Armenian playmaker barely got a look-in for the first few months of the season, despite arriving with the reputation as being one of the best attacking midfielders in Europe last season.
His form for Borussia Dortmund prompted United to pay £27million for him in the summer, and fans were understandably a little baffled when he failed to even make the bench in some early games.
Mkhitaryan needed time to settle in England, claims Mourinho (Picture: Getty) However, Mourinho insists the 28-year-old needed protecting when he first arrived, and that he is now producing ‘other things’ alongside his quality in attack that the Red Devils boss likes to see in his players.
‘Sometimes the best way to protect players is not to play them,’ the Portuguese explained.
‘I think in your chair, your perspective is always “if a player is not playing the manager is disturbing him”, but this is not true.

‘Sometimes we don’t play players, we protect them, and Mkhitaryan was one of these cases.
‘He was being protected and he was adapting and I can see not just what you see, because you see the magic things he can do on the pitch.
‘But I also see other things that I want to see and Mkhitaryan is playing really, really well.’
